You began to come around slowly, your vision was blurred as you rolled over to your side, feeling the hard ground underneath. After a few moments you stood up and looked around, trying to discern where you were, and looking up you could see the stars in the sky.

looking back down at the ground, you could see It looked like a great expanse of concrete spreading across the area where you were, but that did little to help you figure out your location.

The air held a chill to it, causing you to shiver slightly before a loud sound which reminded you of metal sliding against metal filled your ears, turning in the direction of the sound, you eyes widened and your mouth gaped as you saw a giant metal door open, and outstepped a young girl who looked around the age of twelve or thirteen.

But that's not what shocked you.

It was the fact that the girl was a giant!

Or more accuratley, a Giantess.

'She-She's gigantic you thought as your mind was struggling to comprehend what was going on, why was this girl so huge!

'Hang on...' you thought as you looked around, before looking back at the door, upon further inspection, it looked like a roof access door, and the surrounding area was a roof...a giant rooftop.

'M-Maybe she's not huge...maybe I'm just really tiny...but how!

Your thoughts were interupted by the sound of the door closing, and the sight of the girl walking further out onto the roof.

She was wearing a coat that seemed several sizes too large, and shorts, her feet were bare, which seemed an odd combination given the weather.

The girl seemed to walk slowly away from the door, her large frame moving across and pausing at the ledge, resting her arms on it as she seemed to look out over whatever city or town this was.

You're confused mind was now filled with anxiety and debate.

Should you try and get her attention? What would happen if you did!?

Maybe she’s hunting for blood." You said. Abby looks around and keeps moving. Disregarding her, you go back to sleep when a few minutes later, you are awaken by being hoisted up. "What the!?" You said. You look around frantically when you see Abby’s face.

"W….what do you want? I took your hint and left. " You said. She doesn’t say anything and looks at you. "What? If you’re going to drain me of blood, go ahead and do it."
You said. …….

" Does me being a vampire bother you?" She said.

"Your bravery. Or stupidity. Whatever it’s called, I was annoyed, yet amazed, you didn’t back off." She said.
"Well, you got what you wanted." You said.
"I..if I keep you with me, will you be grossed out by what I do?" She said.
"I guess not." You said.
"Ok….. You can stay with me. " She said.

Abby puts you in her coat pocket, but was that the only reason she was out here?

Abby runs back to where she originally found you. She jumped, grab the railing and pulled herself up. She walks into one of the empty rooms and takes you out. “You ok?” She said. “Freezing and tired….. but alive.” You said. Abby heads over to the bed and puts you under the cover. “Get some rest. You had a difficult night.” She said. “Uh…. Sure.” You said. Abby gently rubs you with her index finger, smiling a little. Abby was acting completely different from when she first found you. The way she talked to you….. It wasn’t indifference, annoyance, or anger. She talked liked she cared about you. Abby then stops so you can sleep. (“In the care of a vampire. Hopefully….. It won’t be as bad as it sounds.) You thought. Just as you’re about to sleep, you hear a loud boom. “What the!?” You said. You look to see Abby stomping small insects that got in. “Stupid bugs.” She said, growling a little. Once she was done, Abby sits on the bed and wipes off the remains stuck to her foot. (……I better stay on her good side. ) You thought. Closing your eyes, you drift to sleep.


When morning came, you wake up and notice a hand covering you. “Abby…..?” You said, half asleep. You look to see her sound asleep, even though it’s daytime. “My knowledge of vampire is light. But I know sunlight is her enemy. I guess she sleeps during the day.” You said. While under her hand, you take the opportunity to see if she has a pulse, so you place two fingers on her wrist and there is a beat. “She has one.” You said. Bringing your hand back, you hear Abby growl. “Uh-oh. That can’t be good.” You said. Abby starts growling and hissing loudly. “Stay……away!” She said. “Abby?” You said, worried. “I…..said….. Stay away!!” She said. Her hand clenches around you and pulls you to her sharp teeth. “ABBY!” You shout. Abby’s eyes shoot open and she sees herself holding you close to her mouth. She gasp and sits up to see you slightly shaken.

“Abby….?” You said. “I’m sorry! I didn’t…. bite you, did I? She asked concern. “N…No. I’m fine. What….were you saying about stay away? Was it about me?” You said. “No. Not after I came after you.” “Was it a nightmare?” You said. “……A really bad one.” She said. “About….?” You said. “I don’t…..want to talk about it. Sorry.” She said. “…..ok.” You said. You know when to leave well enough alone. ……Listen. I’m not…..use to being around your kind. Unless I….. You know. So if I’m awkward or anything, don’t hold it against me.” She said. “Just….try your best. And not feed on me.” You said. “…..No promises. Except feeding on you. I won’t do that.” She said. Abby wanted to give it a try to at least understand humans. Or at least you.

“…..You know I can’t go out during the day, right?” She said. “Yeah. I know vampires and sun don’t mix.” You said. “What do…..humans do during the day?” She said. “Well….. Work, school, vacation, there’s a lot we do.” You said. “And you? Do you do any of that?” She said. “School, but winter break for Christmas.” You said. “Christmas? What’s that?” You said. “A holiday where you get presents.” You said. “Presents?” She said. “It’s something you give someone.” You said. “Why would humans do that?” She said. “It’s a way of showing them you care about them.” You said. “Is that one of the ways? I’ve seen other humans do it differently.” She said. “Like?” You said. “One night, I saw two humans whose faces were close together. Then they were smiling.” She said. “Together? You mean kissing?” You said. “Kissing? Is that what you call it?” She said. “Yeah. It’s more of a sign of affection.” You said. “Affection? Like caring?” She said. “On a more personal level. It’s something you do if you really, really like the person.” You said. “…..Your kind does strange things.” She said. She did understand humans a bit more better. “Well…. If we’re trying to understand each other, why don’t you tell me about you?” You said.

Abby didn’t want to tell you about herself. Even though you accepted her being a vampire, she didn’t want to scare you off by telling you all the nasty things she’s done. But you trusted her enough to open up to her. Maybe telling you about herself will make you trust her some more.

My sense of smell is greater. And you know about my teeth.” She said. “What about turning into a bat? Or is that a myth?” You said. “That’s a myth.” She said. “Oh. I bet if you weren’t a vampire, you’d be a good person to be around.” You said. Abby widens her eyes in surprise. You only knew her for a night, and you’re complementing and understanding her. Even thought it was hard for her to open up, you were happy that she did. And she’s warming up to you. Her smile was a bit bigger and she laughed, even though it was a small one.

{'why would anyone make a barrel that big??!!/i} you thought before a noise interrupted your thoughts, turning around quickly you saw a shocking sight.

A girl was climbing in through an open window.

But she was huge!!

The girl was some kind of giantess.

'...Or...Am I just really small!?' you thought as your eyes flashed back to the barrel. Despite the insanity of the notion, it somehow made more sense that you had been shrunken insted of there being a giant girl wandering around.

(Abby POV)

Abby was wearing nothing more than a black t-shirt and jeanshorts, along with a thin hoodie and a pair of flipflops. She made her way through the chill night air with no regard to it's effects as she approached an old warehouse.

She had been coming here more and more lately, it was a place of solitude away from her currrent dwelling.

Reaching down into her pocket she pulled out her smartphone and unlocked it, quickly going to her photos and flipping through them, a variety of pictures where there, ranging from her by herself, and various places, and some of her and an older man.

He seemed to be in his late thirties, and no matter what photo she fipped through, he was always happy.

{'....Owen'/i} she thought to herself with slight sadness.

It had been over three years now since Owen had dissapeared from her life.

No! He hadn't dissapeared, he'd been taken from her.

He'd gone out one night to pick up some groceries, and had been mugged and assaulted, they had left him bleeding in an alley and beaten severely, he had died before anyone could help him.

He had died alone...and hurt...Just the thought of it caused an anger to rise inside of her, though a small smile did come to her face, she had gotten her revenge.

It hadn't taken long to track down the people responsible for Owen's death, and when she did, she had taken much enjoyment out of killing and feeding off of them.

Putting her phone back into her pocket, she jumped up over the fence surrouding the warehouse grounds, floating slowly down onto the ground before approaching one of the floor level windows, her hands reaching down below and pulling the window outward and slipping inside, her eyes allowing her to see the darkly lit atmosphere as clear as day thanks to her night vision.

(Abby POV End)

Starring across at the young girl, you couldn't help but be intimidated by her giant form, she looked no older than 12 or 13, it seemed kind of creepy that she was hanging around in a place like this by herself at night.
